name: Burpee
instructions: From standing, drop to a squat, kick feet back into plank, do a push-up, jump feet forward, and explode up.
Keep rhythm steady and breathe.
Use scaled versions if necessary.
tips: Maintain form over speed to avoid injury.

name: Kettlebell Swing
instructions: Hinge at hips and drive kettlebell forward using hip thrust.
Control the swing on the return.
Keep arms relaxed; power from hips.
tips: Master hip hinge before heavy swings.
ratingDesc: Powerful conditioning movement for posterior chain.

name: Thruster
instructions: Perform a front squat then press the weight overhead in one fluid motion.
Use legs to drive the press.
Keep core braced and avoid rounding.
tips: Good for metabolic conditioning and power.
ratingDesc: Intense full-body movement blending squat and press.

name: Clean & Press (Dumbbell)
instructions: Clean dumbbells to shoulders then press overhead using leg drive.
Control the catch and press phases.
Use hip and leg coordination for the drive.
tips: Good technical lift â€” start light and emphasize form.
ratingDesc: Great for total-body power and athleticism.

name: Farmer's Walk
instructions: Hold heavy weights at sides and walk with upright posture for distance or time.
Keep core braced and shoulders down.
Maintain steady breathing.
tips: Great for grip, core, and conditioning.
ratingDesc: Simple and brutally effective for full-body conditioning.

name: Jump Squat
instructions: Squat down then explode vertically into a jump, land softly and repeat.
Use arm drive and soft knees on landing.
Maintain tension on landing to protect knees.
tips: Limit reps to maintain explosive quality.

name: Battle Ropes
instructions: Grip ropes and perform waves, slams, or alternate movements for intervals.
Use hips and legs to create power.
Keep core engaged for stability.
tips: Great metabolic and upper-body endurance tool.
ratingDesc: High-intensity conditioning with low technical demand.

name: Turkish Get-Up
instructions: From lying, use the kettlebell to stand up while keeping it overhead, then reverse to return to floor.
Move deliberately through each step.
Keep eyes on the kettlebell for stability.
tips: Progress very slowly; great for shoulder and core stability.
